verses.verse: Saul still breathing in the smell of threat and murder for the students of the Master, after going forward to the head priest,
asked from the side of him letters to Damascus to the synagogues in order that if he found any people of the Way (being both men and women), he would lead them (having been tied up) to Jerusalem.
During the time to be traveling, it happened for him to be coming near Damascus. And unexpectedly, a light from the sky was bright all around him.
And after he fell on the ground, he heard a voice saying to him, "Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting Me?"
He said, "Who are You, Master?" The Master said, "I am Jesus, whom you persecute. Is it harsh to you to be kicking toward cattle prods?"

Both trembling and bewildered, he said, "Master, what do you want me to do?" And the Master said to him, "Get up, go into the city, and it will be spoken to you what it is necessary for you to be doing."
The men, the ones who were on the trip together with him, had stood speechless, certainly listening to the voice, but seeing no one.
Saul got up off the ground, but when he had opened his eyes, he was seeing nothing. Leading him by the hand, they led him into Damascus.
And he was not seeing for three days. He also did not eat, nor drink.
There was a certain student in Damascus with the name Ananias. And the Master said to him in a sighting, "Ananias." Ananias said, "Look, it is me, Master."
The Master said to him, "When you get up, travel on the street, the one called Straight, and look in Jude's house for Saul by name, a Tarsean. You see, look, he is praying,
and he saw in a sighting a man with the name Ananias, who went in and placed a hand on him in order that he might see again."
Ananias responded, "Master, I have heard from many about this man, how many bad things he did to Your sacred people in Jerusalem.
And here he has authority from the side of the head priests to lock up all the people calling on Your Name."
But the Master said to him, "Travel there because he is a container of a selection by Me. This man is of the 'to haul My name in the sight of non-Jews, kings, and sons of Israel' kind.
You see, I will put in front of his face how many things it is necessary for him to suffer on behalf of My Name."

Ananias went off and went into the house. And when he placed his hands on him, he said, "Saul, brother, the Master has sent me out, Jesus, the One who saw you in the road that you were coming on, in order that you might see again and be filled with the Sacred Spirit."
And right away, as if they were flakes they fell off his eyes, and at once he saw again. And when he got up, he was submerged.
And after he received a meal, he was invigorated. Saul became with the students in Damascus for some days.
And right away he was speaking publicly about the Anointed King in the synagogues, that this is the Son of God.

All the people listening were being astounded and saying, "Isn't this the one who damaged the people calling on this name in Jerusalem and here he had come for this, so that he might lead them (having been tied up) before the head priests?"
Saul was receiving more ability, and he was stirring up the Jewish people, the ones residing in Damascus, inferring that this is the Anointed King.
As an adequate amount of days were being accomplished, the Jewish people together advised to execute him.
Their conspiracy was known to Saul. They were even closely watching the gates both day and night in order that they might execute him.
After the students took him at night, they let him down through the wall after lowering him in a big basket.
When Saul showed up in Jerusalem, he was trying to be stuck like glue to the students. And all feared him, not trusting that he is a student.

But after Barnabas latched on to him, he led him to the missionaries and described to them how in the road he saw the Master, that He spoke to him, and how in Damascus he was straightforward in the name of Jesus.
And he was with them traveling in and traveling out in Jerusalem.
And being straightforward in the name of the Master Jesus, he was both speaking and posing questions to the Greek-speaking Jews, but the Greek-speaking Jews were attempting to execute him.
When the brothers correctly understood it, they led him down to Caesarea and sent him off to Tarsus.

So the assemblies certainly were having peace throughout all of Judea, Galilee, and Samaria. Being built and traveling in the fear of the Master and the encouragement of the Sacred Spirit, they were increasing.
It happened for Peter, going through everywhere, to also go down to the sacred people, the ones residing in Lydda.
There he found a certain person with the name Aeneas, laying down on a mattress for eight years, who had been disabled.
And Peter said to him, "Aeneas, Jesus, the Anointed King, is curing you. Stand up and spread your mattress out for yourself." And right away he stood up.
And all the people residing in Lydda and the plain of Sharon saw him, some who turned back to the Master.

In Joppa there was a certain student with the name Tabitha, that being thoroughly interpreted from Aramaic she is called Gazelle. She was full of good actions and charitable donations that she was making.
She happened (in those days when she was weak) to die. After they gave her a bath, they placed her in an upstairs room.
Since Lydda is near Joppa, when the students heard that Peter is in it, they sent two men out to him encouraging him not to hesitate to come on through to them.

After Peter got up, he went together with them, whom, when he showed up, they led up to the upstairs room, and all the widows stood by him crying and showing as many long undershirts and clothes as the Gazelle was making as she was with them.

After Peter put everyone outside, when he placed his knees on the floor, he prayed. And when he turned around toward the body, he said, "Tabitha, get up." The girl opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter, she sat up on her own.
After giving her a hand, he got her up. When he hollered for the sacred people and the widows, he presented her alive.
It became known throughout all of Joppa, and many people trusted based on the Master.
It happened for him to stay an adequate amount of days in Joppa beside a certain Simon, a leatherworker.
